dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 2352 IH: State, Tribal, and Local Species Transparency and Recovery Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Neugebauer (for himself, Mr. Newhouse, Mrs. Lummis, Mr. Huizenga of Michigan, and Mr. Collins of Georgia) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Endangered Species Act of 1973 to require making available to States affected by determinations that species are endangered species or threatened species all data that is the basis of such determinations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the State, Tribal, and Local Species Transparency and Recovery Act.

section.header: Decisional transparency and use of state, tribal, and local information

subsection.header: Requiring decisional transparency with affected states
subsection.text: Section 6(a) of the Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16 U.S.C. 1535(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting (1) before the first sentence; and
by striking Such cooperation shall include and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: before making a determination under section 4(a), providing to States affected by such determination all data that is the basis of the determination; and

subsection.header: Ensuring use of State, tribal, and local information

paragraph.text: Section 3 of the Endangered Species Act of 1973 (16 U.S.C. 1532) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (2) through (21) as paragraphs (3) through (22), respectively; and
by inserting after paragraph (1) the following:

paragraph.text: The term best scientific and commercial data available includes all such data submitted by a State, tribal, or county government.
Section 7(n) of such Act (16 U.S.C. 1536(n)) is amended by striking section 3(13) and inserting section 3(14).
